text: We drove away the swarm of Will-o'-wisps and made our way deeper into the labyrinth, butー

name: Jisai
text: N-No way...? Is this... the first room...?
As soon as we entered the new room, Shishigami froze.

name: Me
text: ...So it comes back around to the start, huh.
What appeared in front of us was the semi-basement study we had found when we had first gone down the stairs.
It also wasn't a case of it being a different room built to simply look the same.
The corpse of the broker lying in the corner of the roomーwithout a doubt, it was proof that this was the first room.

name: Shonosuke
text: Needless to say, we won't be able to break out by just walking around blindly...

name: Jisai
text: Even so, the fact that we ended up back where we started...

name: Shonosuke
text: It seems like it's that kind of trap. I'm not sure if the time or the number of the rooms play a role, but we'll be sent back to this room eventually.

name: Jisai
text: That can't be...
Shishigami and Shonosuke sounded dejected. They probably didn't want to admit it, but they looked as if they thought that the situation was quite hopeless.
But I thought differently.

name: Me
text: Wait, it might actually be fine.

name: Jisai
text: Fuma...? Huh, what!? What are you doing over there...!?

name: Me
text: What am I doing? A body search, I guess.
I had crouched down beside the corpse lying in a pool of blood and was rummaging around the body.

name: Shonosuke
text: Kotaro-sama? I also checked whether there was something like a key or a tool for the spell, but there wasn't really...

name: Me
text: Yeah, how should I say it, but... After going through it once, I realized that this labyrinth is strikingly similar to the one I read about in the "Biography of the Witch."

name: Shonosuke
text: And...?

name: Me
text: From the structure of the labyrinth to the interior of the rooms, it is exactly the same as the description in the book... But that's impossible.

name: Me
text: Sorcery inevitably contain the tendencies of the person who cast them. No matter how much the creator tries to make a spell look the same, there is always a limit.

name: Jisai
text: What do you mean...?

name: Me
text: My guess is that... the broker lied about just one thing.
I explained while I continued to search the broker's body.

name: Me
text: He said that he had a sorcerer from Amidahara make this trapーbut that's probably a lie.

name: Me
text: It's hard to believe, but it was the actual witch from the biography who created this labyrinth.

name: Shonosuke
text: The actual witch!? No way... is that possible!?

name: Me
text: This guy must have gone through a lot of trouble to find her.

name: Me
text: Those whose biographies are written are not always dead. Because sorcerers and witches and the like often live oddly long lives.

name: Jisai
text: But even if it's true that the witch herself created the labyrinth... What does that mean for us...?

name: Me
text: Right. Now here's the real issue at hand.
I grinned as I searched the bloody corpse.
Looking at me would objectively give one the impression I was a psychopath, but there was nothing to do but have them bear with me.

name: Me
text: The "Biography of the Witch" said that she had made notes on how to get out of the labyrinth in case she got lost. Andー
My fingertips touched something on the reverse side of the inner suit pocket.

name: Me
text: And in her biography it said that she had hidden those notes in the fabric of her jacket so nobody would find them. ーGot it!!
When I pulled my hand out, there was a small piece of paper between my fingers.

name: Jisai
text: F-Fuma!? Is that really the memo on how to get out of this labyrinth...!?

name: Me
text: Probably. Let me see... "First it should be too many. Then proceed 6 and verily insomnia is inevitable"ー

name: Me
text: It seems to be some kind of cipher... but I should be able solve this in a minute.
